Description: Fragment of neck and flattened handle to sharp turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine red-brown; cream slip. Circular stamp with rose symbol.
Curator's comments: Ink, deleted, '2.2'. Name Anaxilas. Examples from the same die in the Athenian Agora and the Benaki collection, Alexandria Museum (ABC 0315.23).
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (9)
